drupalNodeEvent.title: The Interpretive Principles of Qing Scholars– Bernhard Karlgren's Critique

field_speakers.processed:
Presenter: Magnus Ribbing Gren (Princeton, Ph.D.)
Chair: Steven B. Miles (Hong Kong University of Science and Technology)
Discussants: Martin Kern (Princeton), Ori Sela (Tel Aviv)

field_description.processed:
Virtual Lecture: The Interpretive Principles of Qing Scholars– Bernhard
Karlgren's Critique

We are happy to announce a special session to be hosted by "Philology in
Our Time: The Early China Projec Room" on Monday October 10, 2022, 8:00
PM Taipei/Hong Kong (8:00 AM EST UTC-5h) on Zoom.

Presenter: Magnus Ribbing Gren (Princeton, Ph.D.)

Chair: Steven B. Miles (Hong Kong University of Science and Technology)

Discussants: Martin Kern (Princeton), Ori Sela (Tel Aviv)

Please register to receive the Zoom link:
https://pitt.zoom.us/.../tJYqde6pqjwtG9CM4TRSdHSDvkz3aAgR...

The event will be recorded, but recording will be shared only upon
request, with the permission of the speaker.

For further information about the online colloquium, including a
schedule and materials related to upcoming sessions, please visit our
website (philologyinourtime.org).
